definition: a dandy/a fop/Don Juan/a ladies man
Tang dynasty (618-907)/surname Tang
to exaggerate/empty/in vain/old variant of 螗[tang2]
semicircular jade ornament

sentences.english: I think at this point of all those who absolutely insist that Don Juan be punished.
sentences.chinese: 此刻，我想到了所有那些堅持唐璜有罪的頑固分子。

sentences.english: As for Don Juan, the more people laugh at him, the more his figure stands out.
sentences.chinese: 至於唐璜，嘲笑他的人越多，他的形象就越是分明。

sentences.english: Don Juan is already getting ready for it.
sentences.chinese: 唐璜已經爲此準備就緒。
說不定他就是你的唐璜？

sentences.english: In the universe of which Don Juan has a glimpse, ridicule too is included. He would consider it normal to be chastised.
sentences.chinese: 唐璜隱約窺探到的宇宙中也包括奚落和譏笑。

sentences.english: "Love them and leave them" was the motto of the amorous Don Juan.
sentences.chinese: “愛她們隨後拋棄她們”是風流浪蕩子唐璜的座右銘。

sentences.english: No, it was not under a stone hand that Don Juan met his death.
sentences.chinese: 不，唐璜並非死於一隻石手之下。

sentences.english: For Don Juan the thing is simpler.
sentences.chinese: 而至於唐璜，事情就簡化了許多。

sentences.english: That is why I made you advance along the path of the Don Juan phantasy.
sentences.chinese: 那就是爲什麼我要你們前進，沿着唐璜幻見到途徑。

sentences.english: But he rejects regret, that other form of hope.
sentences.chinese: 但是唐璜拒絕後悔，拒絕這另一種形式的希望。

sentences.english: He is their worst enemy to the extent that he is ignorant of them.
sentences.chinese: 唐璜是他們的最大敵人，因爲他無視他們的存在。

sentences.english: Don Juan does not think of "collecting" women.
Don Juan knows and does not hope.
sentences.chinese: 唐璜知道但不希望這樣。

sentences.english: Minuet of Don Giovanni he's playing now.
sentences.chinese: 他現在正彈着《唐璜》的小步舞曲。

sentences.english: As for satiety, Don Juan insists upon it, on the contrary.
sentences.chinese: 至於滿足，唐璜則相反，他一直堅持如此。

definition: Othello (play by Shakespeare)
Hector Berlioz (1803-1869), French romantic composer, author of Symphonie Fantastique
Puccini
Western opera/CL:場|场[chang3],齣|出[chu1]
Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart (1756-1791), Austrian composer
Falstaff (Shakespearian character)
Molière (1622-1673), French playwright and actor, master of comedy
Tchaikovsky (1840-1893), Russian composer
Romeo and Juliet, 1594 tragedy by William Shakespeare 莎士比亞|莎士比亚
pinyin: Luo2 mi4 ou1 yu3 Zhu1 li4 ye4

definition: Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
Prosper Mérimée (1803-1870), French scholar and writer, author of novel Carmen on which Bizet based his opera
Carmen (name)/Carmen, 1875 opera by Georges Bizet 比才 based on novel by Prosper Mérimée 梅里美[Mei2 li3 mei3]
Brahms (name)/Johannes Brahms (1833-1897), German romantic composer
Shakespeare/slang or popular culture abbr. of 莎士比亞|莎士比亚[Sha1 shi4 bi3 ya4]
Shakespeare (name)/William Shakespeare (1564-1616), poet and playwright
Piotr Ilyich Tchaikowsky (1840-1893), Russian composer, composer of 6 symphonies and the opera Eugene Onegin
